schema.description: The LLDP notification when neighbor is added or deleted.

neighbor.description: The LLDP notification when neighbor is added or deleted.

neighbor-info.description: The LLDP notification when neighbor is added or deleted.

rem-chassis-id.description: Value to indicate basis identifier in chassis ID field.

action.description: LLDP neighbor action type, add or delete.

man-addr-subtype.description:
Subtype of the management address.

The value '1' indicates the IPv4 address.

The value '2' indicates the IPv6 address.

For the definition of other values, refer to IANA-ADDRESS-FAMILY-NUMBERS-MIB.

adminstatus.description: The administratively desired status of the local LLDP agent.If the associated rt-enable node has a value of 'txOnly(1)', then LLDP agent can transmit LLDP frames on all ports and it will not store any information about the remote systems connected.If the associated rt-enable node has a value of 'rxOnly(2)', then the LLDP agent can receive,but it will not transmitLLDP frames on all ports. If the associated rt-enable node has a value of 'txAndRx(3)', then the LLDP agent can transmit and receive LLDP frames on all ports.If the associated rt-enable node has a value of 'disabled(4)', then LLDP agent will not transmit or receive LLDP frames on all ports. If there is remote systems information which is received and stored, before rt-enable becomes disabled, then the information will naturally age out. This leaf has a default value, but value depends on the OS and the device.

hellotime.description: The interval at which LLDP frames are transmitted on behalf of this LLDP agent. The default value for hellotime node is 30 seconds. The value of this object must be restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system

holdtime.description:
The time-to-live value expressed as a multiple of the hellotime node. The actual time-to-live value used in LLDP frames, transmitted on behalf of this LLDP agent,can be expressed by the following formula: TTL = min(65535,(lldpMessageTxInterval* lldpMessageTxHoldMultiplier)) For example, if the value oflldpMessageTxInterval is '30', and the value of holdtime is '4', then the value '120' is encoded in the TTL field in the LLDP header.

  The default value for lldpMessageTxHoldMultiplier object is 4.

  The value of this object must be restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

maxneighbor.description: The max number of the neighbor to save. It's default value and max value depends on ability of the device.

msgfast.description: The interval at which LLDP frames are transmitted on behalf of this LLDP agent during fast transmission period (e.g. when a new neighbor is detected).The default value for msgfast node is 1 second. The value of this object is restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

txcreditmax.description: The maximum number of consecutive LLDP PDUs that can be transmitted at any time. The default value for txcreditmax object is 5 PDUs.The value of this object is restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

txfastinit.description: The initial value used to initialize the txFast variable which determines the number of transmissions that are made in fast transmission mode.The default value for txfastinit node is 4.The value of this node is restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

neighborreport.description: Set LLDP neighbor report netconf notification enable or disable.

reinitdelay.description: The lldpReinitDelay indicates the delay (in units of seconds) from when lldpPortConfigAdminStatus object of a particular port becomes 'disabled' until re-initialization will be attempted.

tlvoption.description: Configure whether TLVs are allowed to be transmitted.

ztp.description: Configure whether ZTP TLV is allowed to be transmitted.

portname.description: The port name used to identify the port component(contained in the local chassis with the LLDP agent)associated with this entry.

adminstatus.description: The administratively desired status of the local LLDP agent.If the associated rt-enable node has a value of 'txOnly(1)', then LLDP agent will transmit LLDP frames on this port andit will not store any information about the remote systems connected.If the associated rt-enable node object has a value of 'rxOnly(2)', then the LLDP agent will receive,but it will not transmit LLDP frames on this port.If the associated rt-enable node object has a value of 'txAndRx(3)', then the LLDP agent will transmitn and receive LLDP frames on this port.If the associated lldpPortConfigAdminStatus object has a value of 'disabled(4)', then LLDP agent will not transmit or receive LLDP frames on this port.  If there is remote systems information which is received on this port and stored in other tables, before the port's rt-enable node becomes disabled, then the information will naturally age out. This leaf has a default value, but value depends on the OS and the device.

maxneighbor.description: The max number of the neighbor of the port.It's max value depends on ability of the device. The default value is 8.

transparent.description: The transparent controls, on a per port basis, whether or not the received packets are fowarded. The value enable(1) means that the port will foward the received packets; the value disable(2) means that the port will not foward the received packets.

notification.description: Whether or not notifications from the agent are enabled.

tlvoption.description: Configure whether TLVs are allowed to be transmitted.

dcb-pfc-cfg.description: Configure whether PFC configuration TLV is allowed to be transmitted.

ztp.description: Configure whether ZTP TLV is allowed to be transmitted.

portcfgv2.description: Configuring interface parameters of LLDP Version 2.

portname.description: The port name used to identify the port component(contained in the local chassis with the LLDP agent)associated with this entry.

destmactype.description: The value used to identify the standard group MAC addressesthat can be used by LLDP. The choice of address used determines the scope of propagation of LLDPDUs within a bridged LAN. If the node is set to a value of 'nearest-non-tpmr-bridge', then LLDP agent transmits LLDPframes with the destinationaddress 01-80-C2-00-00-03. If the node is set to a value of'nearest-customer-bridge', then LLDP agent transmits LLDPframes with the destination address 01-80-C2-00-00-00.

adminstatus.description: The administratively desired status of the local LLDP agent. If the node is set to a value of 'txOnly(1)', then LLDP agent transmits LLDPframes on this port and it does not store any information about the remote systems connected. If the node is set to a value of 'rxOnly(2)', then the LLDP agent receives, but it does not transmit LLDP frames on this port. If the node is set to a value of 'txAndRx(3)', then the LLDP agent transmits and receives LLDP frames on this port. If the node is set to a value of 'disabled(4)', then LLDP agent does not transmit or receive LLDP frames on this port.

tx-frames-total.description: Global count of sent lldp packets.

rx-frames-total.description: Global count of received lldp packets.

rx-frames-errors.description: Global count of received error lldp packets.

rx-frames-discard.description: Global count of discarded lldp packets.

rx-tlvs-discard.description: Global count of discarded TLVs of lldp packets.

rx-tlvs-unrecognized.description: Global count of unrecognized TLVs of lldp packets.

neighbor-add.description: Global count of having been added new neighbors.

neighbor-delete.description: Global count of having been deleted neighbors.

neighbor-ageout.description: Global count of having been aged neighbors.

neighbor-drop.description: Global count of having been dropped neighbors.

tx-frames-total.description: Count of sent lldp packets of port.

rx-frames-total.description: Count of received lldp packets of port.

rx-frames-errors.description: Count of received error lldp packets of port.

rx-frames-discard.description: Count of discarded lldp packets of port.

rx-tlvs-discard.description: Count of discarded TLVs of lldp packets of port.

rx-tlvs-unrecognized.description: Count of unrecognized TLVs of lldp packets of port.

neighbor-add.description: Count of having been added new neighbors.

neighbor-delete.description: Count of having been deleted new neighbors.

neighbor-ageout.description: Count of having been aged new neighbors

neighbor-drop.description: Count of having been dropped new neighbors.

rem-chassis-id.description: Value to indicate basis identifier in chassis ID field.

ttl.description: Hold on time of neighbor keeping alive.

rem-sys-cap.description: Capability of system of remote neighbor.

rem-sys-desc.description: Description of remote system of remote neighbor.

rem-chassis-id.description: Value to indicate basis identifier in chassis ID field.

rem-chassis-id-subtype.description: Subtype of the chassis ID of remote neighbor.

rem-port-id.description: Identifier in port ID field of neighbor. Value according to PortIdSubType.

rem-port-id-subtype.description: Value to indicate basis identifier in port ID field.

ttl.description: Hold on time of neighbor keeping alive.

rem-port-desc.description: Description of port of remote neighbor.

rem-sys-desc.description: Description of remote system of remote neighbor.

rem-sys-cap.description: Capability of system of remote neighbor.

rem-link-aggregation.description: Link aggregation information of port of remote neighbor.

man-addr-subtype.description:
Subtype of the management address.

The value '1' indicates the IPv4 address.

The value '2' indicates the IPv6 address.

For the definition of other values, refer to IANA-ADDRESS-FAMILY-NUMBERS-MIB.

system-desc.description: System description of LLDP local system data.
